doc.previous: Indianapolis is the capital of Indiana and its largest city.[69][71] Indiana's four largest metropolitan areas are Indianapolis, Fort Wayne, Evansville, and South Bend.[72] The table below lists the ten largest municipalities in the state based on the 2012 United States Census Estimate.[73]
after: The United States Census Bureau estimates that the population of Indiana was 6,596,855 on July 1, 2014, a 1.74% increase since the 2010 United States Census.[2]

The state's population density was 181.0Â persons per square mile, the 16th highest in the United States.[69] As of the 2010 U.S. Census, Indiana's population center is located northwest of Sheridan, in Hamilton County (+40.149246, -086.259514).[69][75][76]
